SEARCH
Package com.cmrl.utils

Class TimeCalculator

java.lang.Object
com.cmrl.utils.TimeCalculator
public class TimeCalculator extends Object
Utility class to calculate travel time between metro stations and determine ticket validity duration.

This class provides static methods to:

  • Estimate journey time based on stops and interchanges.
  • Return ticket validity duration for different ticket types.
ðŸš‡ Example: Can be used in metro ticketing or route-planning systems.

Thread Safety: Since this class only contains static methods and immutable constants, it is thread-safe.

  • Method Summary

    Modifier and Type
    Method
    Description
    static int
    calculateTime(int stops, boolean interchange)
    Calculate estimated travel time in minutes based on number of stops and whether the journey includes an interchange.
    static int
    getValidity(String ticketType)
    Get ticket validity duration (in minutes) for a given ticket type.

  • Method Details

    • calculateTime

      public static int calculateTime(int stops, boolean interchange)
      Calculate estimated travel time in minutes based on number of stops and whether the journey includes an interchange.
      Parameters:
      stops - number of stops (must be >= 0)
      interchange - true if journey includes an interchange, false otherwise
      Returns:
      estimated travel time in minutes

      Example: 

      
 int time = TimeCalculator.calculateTime(10, true);
 // returns ~18 minutes (15 for stops + 3 for interchange)

    • getValidity

      public static int getValidity(String ticketType)
      Get ticket validity duration (in minutes) for a given ticket type. If the type is not recognized, default validity = 120 minutes.
      Parameters:
      ticketType - type of ticket (e.g., SJT, RJT, FAMILY, GROUP, SVP)
      Returns:
      validity in minutes

      Example: 

      
 int validity = TimeCalculator.getValidity("SJT");
 // returns 120
